text:
Hey, girls. I'm sorry to interrupt you all all of
a sudden, but I need to talk to you about
something.
First, I have a job lined up.

I'll explain what it's all about, so think hard if
you can or want to do it or not.

It's a sales job,
You girls will sing on stage at a fireworks show.

Yeah. Besides you girls, there will be local children
dancing, Enka singers, hero shows, and comedians.
I'm sure someone from the industry is taking notice.

...It's certainly may not be the most glamorous place,
the stage is small, and the seats are about 30 pipe chairs.

The audience is mainly from the community, standing room
only, no partitions, and the AV equipment isn't that great.

So, depending on what everyone wants out of the job,
this request may not be worth it.

If you don't feel it's worth it,
I wouldn't encourage you to perform.

I'll keep looking. Until I find something of worth to you.
Something you can all respect. You have my word on that.

And, so. I want you all to be able to think about this carefully.
Whether you want to be there, or whether you don't.

In work, you'll be put up against some bad experiences.
Sometimes we're asked to be more poised than we think we should be.

If you still want to do it, whether it be singing or just to stand out.
I'm sure you're going to want a reason to hold on to.

And ultimately, if you decide you just want to quit...
that's fine too.

Once you've taken all that in,
then I want you to think about it.
